tablerow.en-p: I hope you have a good day.
Such I also pray for you.

tablerow.p: An. Bene sit tibi hōc diē.
tablerow.en-p: May everything go well for you today.
I hope you are very well.
And I hope you are just as well.
I pray that you have good health.
And I hope the same for you.
I command you to be well.

tablerow.p: Ca. Hic vesper fēlīx sit tibi.
tablerow.en-p: May this evening be happy for you.
And may it not be unhappy for you.

tablerow.p: De. Sit tibi haec nox fēlīx.
tablerow.en-p: May this night be happy for you.

tablerow.p: Eu. Et tibi fausta haec sit.
tablerow.en-p: And may it be fortunate for you.
May you spend a fortunate night.
You also, not an unfortunate one.
May this your night go well for you.
And may it non go badly for you.
So what are you gonna do?
I won’t stop you from anything.
I’m asking you to quit being annoying.
What should I be ashamed of?
The first hour is coming up.
Why don’t you get up, you bum?
I’m gonna wake you up with a stick soon.
I’m getting up now; please, let me be.
So what? What are you afraid of?
The assigned time has gone by.
What time are you talking about?
There’s no reason to doubt it.
What do you want? Why should I wait?
There’s something I need to tell you.
You refuse such a little thing?
Is it really something that concerns me?
That you won’t be a jerk about it.
Why my ear? Say it out loud.
I won’t say it out loud.
Now you’re making fun of me.
You won’t get away with this.
What would I do over there?
How many times have you read it out?

tablerow.p: La. Recitāvī semel (I), bis (II), ter (III), quater (IIII).
tablerow.en-p: I’ve recited it once, twice, thrice, four times.
Who did you read it to?
If you don’t know something, ask.
Why are you choppy in your speech?
Now you’re rushing through the words.
You should read distinctly, like this.
I can’t do it that clearly.
I’ll see what I can do.
What Informer are you talking about?
The ones who are secretly writing notes about us.
You don’t know any of them?
I would, if I knew how.
But that way you’ll learn faster.
By this hope, the rod is sweetened.
Are you making fun of me, too?
But why hadn’t you learned anything?
I’ll be more careful after this.
Where are you heading off to?
Which way are you gonna go?
No, but I am giving you a break.
Where are you coming back from?
What did you have for breakfast?
There’s nothing I can return it with.
Get this pen ready for me.
I do, but it’s very dull.
Do you want it thick, or thin?

tablerow.p: Pe. Et haec in prōmptū est.

tablerow.en-p: What do you want me to write?
I will do as you say.
Where are you hurrying to like that?
What will you do at home?
I do what my dad wants.
I’m here; what do you need me for?
It is, when it so pleases.
It will be taken care of properly.
First I’ll fill it with salt.
The ones you should mind at the table.
I ask you to teach me.
I will do that very gladly.

tablerow.p: Deus pater noster caelestis benedīcat nōbīs fīliīs suīs et hīs quae iam sumus sūmptūrī, per Chrīstum dominum nostrum, Āmēn.
tablerow.en-p: "May God, our heavenly Father, bless us His children and these things we are about to receive, through Christ Our Lord, amen."
Don't hold it in your fist.
Don't be the first to eat.
Take the things closest to you.
Don’t get absorbed in your plate.
Wipe your mouth before you drink.
Not with your hand; with your napkin.
Don’t smear stuff on your mouth.
Be quiet if you’re not asked anything.
When you've had enough, get up.
Pick up the stuff on the table.

tablerow.p: Quī nōs creāvit, redēmit et pāvit, illī grātiās agimus sempiternās, per Iēsum Chrīstum dominum nostrum, Āmēn.
tablerow.en-p: “Who has created us, redeemed, and fed, to Him we give thanks forever, through Jesus Christ Our Lord, amen.
What are you carrying in your pocket?
I will buy myself some bread.
That’s how it happened to me.
You’d be ruined if you had more freedom.
What is it? Why are you shaking?

tablerow.p: Vi. Quid ita? Quā dē causā?

tablerow.en-p: What is this I hear from you?
Where is he, I beseech you?

tablerow.p: Vi. Quis id ait? Quis vīdit?
tablerow.en-p: Who says so? Who saw him?
I myself saw him, I say.
Did he see that we’re playing?
That way he’ll think we’re learning.

tablerow.p: Xa. Quid est quod sīc gestīs?
tablerow.en-p: What is it that you’re celebrating like that?
What free days are you talking about?
When will we have our break?
What game do you rather play?
Because it wears my feet out.
What should I be ashamed of?
So then why won’t you jump?
Be careful you don’t get me started.
You’ll see what I can do.
But why did you get up?
What sort of marker did you set?
Why don’t you just go away?
Are you going to throw me out by force?
What sort of work is there?
That’s how you're a good friend.
You could if you wanted to.
I'd want to if I could.
What do you do after dinner?
I go for a walk after dinner.
I learn it the next day.
I took a bath at home.
How long did you take a bath?
Who took a bath with you?
What did you do after your bath?

tablerow.p: Be. Cūr nōn ībās in scholam?
tablerow.en-p: Why didn’t you go to school?
Where did you just crawl out of?
I haven’t seen you in a long time.
And I haven’t seen you longer.
And I’m glad to hear it.
I don’t know who you are.
I wouldn’t deny if I did.
I have never seen you before.
I’m not, or are you instead?
I had made that one for you.
I know you because of the scar.
You see that I am not crazy.
I wouldn’t have known you by what you look like.
What do you want me to give back?
Why don’t you give it back, then?
You have it in your clothes.
You’re still going to be annoying?
Are you accusing me of theft.
Not of theft, but of lying.
I’ll pay you back for this insult.

tablerow.p: Ge. Quid est? Cūr mē vocās?
tablerow.en-p: What is it? Why are you calling me?
There’s something I want you for.
What do you think I want?
That I play a game with you.
We’re going out to a funeral.
What funeral are you talking about?
I don’t know which it is.
But where did you learn about it?
What time will he be carried out?
So I'm not asking for no reason.
So then why are you asking?

tablerow.p: Ge. Hōc vīnum nōbīs faustum sit. Bonō sit pōtus iste. Hōc vīnum laetī bibite.
tablerow.en-p: May this wine be auspicious for us. May the drink be for the good. Rejoice as you drink this wine.
What do you pray for someone sneezing?

tablerow.p: Ge. Sit tibi hōc fēlīx. Tē Deus servet.
tablerow.en-p: May this turn out well for you. May God preserve you.
What about for someone looking for omens?

tablerow.p: Ge. Bonō sit quod īnstituis. Bene vertat quod agis.
tablerow.en-p: May what you are starting go well. May what you are doing turn out well.
What about for someone starting a journey?

tablerow.p: Ge. Sit iter hōc fēlīx tibi. Perfaustē solvās ancoram. Sit laetus tibi reditus.
tablerow.en-p: May this trip be fortunate for you. May you loose your anchor very fortunately. May you have a happy return.
What should I respond to someone saying such prayers?
I pray for the same to you.
